div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1010 Visuntsy region, 10 km. N of Kher- (1152) son, Ukraine, 1929 Burial: 400-350 B.C. (Zaginailo) Contents: 141+ AR Istrus: dr. (as AMNG I.1, pl. 2, 20) Disposition: Kherson (Kherson Oblast Reg. Mus.) 31-32; Leningrad 10; Odessa 2; Muzykovka (village school) 1; private coll. 92 † Krisin, Khronika arkheologii ta mistetsva 1 (Kiev, 1930), p. 69 (in Ukrainian) Zaginailo, Zapiski Odesskogo Arkheologicheskogo Obshchestva 34 (1960), pp. 316-8; † 35 (1967), pp. 60-75 Information from IU. L. Diukov (Hermitage material) Mitrea, StudClas 7 (1965), pp. 152-3, nos. 3b-c In the literature these coins are considered as coming from two hds.: 1929 (Krisin), 13+ AR; 1951 (Zaginailo, ZOAO II), 113+ AR. According to the most recent opinion, not yet published, of Karyszkowski and Zaginailo, the probability is one hd., whose coins were widely dispersed over a number of years: 1929 (Krisin), 13+; 1930 and 1934 (Archives of the Inst. of Arch., Acad. of Sciences, Ukrainian SSR, Kiev, File of Scholarly Works, no. 150, materials of Fabritsius), 15+; 1951 (Zaginailo, ZOAO II), 113+
